description: Number of occurrences of most frequent digit in decimal expansion of Pi.
links: Harvey P. Dale, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
example: a(50)=9 because 3 appears 9 times in the first 50 digits of pi and other digits appear less frequently
mathematica: Module[{nn=90,pidg},pidg=RealDigits[Pi,10,nn][[1]];Table[Max[ Transpose[ Tally[ Take[pidg,n]]][[2]]],{n,nn}]] (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Apr 06 2016 *)
author: _Henry Bottomley_, Mar 08 2000
